title: [BUG] Zlib security identification
body:
### Description

SkiaSharp is showing up in our security idenificaiton software as utilizing zlib 1.2.13.1 which has the open CVE, [CVE-2023-45853](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-45853). This CVE in specific relates to Minizip. Can zlib either be updated to the latest 1.3.1 which has the fix or confirm that SkiaSharp does not use/include minizip?


### Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)


### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
**Closing as not affected** — SkiaSharp does not use MiniZip.

CVE-2023-45853 affects the **MiniZip** component (`contrib/minizip/`) bundled with zlib, not core zlib itself. SkiaSharp/Skia does not compile or link MiniZip.

**Evidence:**

1. Skia's `third_party/zlib/BUILD.gn` only includes core zlib files (adler32.c, compress.c, deflate.c, etc.) — no `contrib/minizip/` sources
2. No MiniZip headers (`unzip.h`, `zip.h`) are included anywhere in Skia
3. No MiniZip functions (`unzOpen`, `zipOpen`, etc.) are called

Core zlib (deflate/inflate) **is** used by SkiaSharp for PDF compression and PNG support, but those functions are unaffected by this CVE.

If your security scanner flags this, it's a false positive — you can safely exclude it.
